articles.headline: A Portfolio’s Price
articles.snippet: Buyout specialists are seemingly at odds over how their investments are or are not panning out.
articles.abstract: Buyout specialists are seemingly at odds over how their investments are or are not panning out.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is the brass-tacks question every stock investor asks: What is this company really worth?

articles.headline: Birthright Citizenship Looms as Next Immigration Battle
articles.snippet: Hard-liners want an end to “anchor babies,” despite mixed evidence about why parents cross the border.
articles.abstract: Hard-liners want an end to “anchor babies,” despite mixed evidence about why parents cross the border.
articles.lead_paragraph: NOGALES, Ariz.  Of the 50 or so women bused to this border town on a recent morning to be deported back to Mexico, Inez Vasquez stood out. Eight months pregnant, she had tried to trudge north in her fragile state, even carrying scissors with her in case she gave birth in the desert and had to cut the umbilical cord.

articles.headline: Cheney Is Back, With Heart Pump and New Outlook
articles.snippet: Since receiving a device that saved his life, Dick Cheney is focused on finishing his memoir and stepping back, gingerly, into public life.
articles.abstract: Since receiving a device that saved his life, Dick Cheney is focused on finishing his memoir and stepping back, gingerly, into public life.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by Helene Cooper, Lawrence K. Altman and Michael D. Shear.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper, Lawrence K. Altman and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Taking DNA Sequencing to the Masses
articles.snippet: Jonathan Rothberg has created several companies that lower the cost of DNA sequencing and broaden its usage.
articles.abstract: Jonathan Rothberg has created several companies that lower the cost of DNA sequencing and broaden its usage.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jonathan M. Rothberg fancies himself the Steve Jobs of biotechnology. While much less known than the Apple leader, Dr. Rothberg is also a wealthy entrepreneur with a reputation as a visionary, a masterful promoter and a demanding boss.

articles.headline: Resurgent Turkey Flexes Its Muscles Around Iraq
articles.snippet: Turkey’s ascent may prove its biggest success so far in an effort to project its heft across a region long suspicious of it.
articles.abstract: Turkey’s ascent may prove its biggest success so far in an effort to project its heft across a region long suspicious of it.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZAKHO, Iraq  A Turkey as resurgent as at any time since its Ottoman glory is projecting influence through a turbulent Iraq, from the boomtowns of the north to the oil fields near southernmost Basra, in a show of power that illustrates its growing heft across an Arab world long suspicious of it.

articles.headline: G.O.P. Asks Businesses Which Rules to Rewrite
articles.snippet: In a letter, 150 businesses, trade groups and research organizations were asked to say which federal regulations they would want fixed.
articles.abstract: In a letter, 150 businesses, trade groups and research organizations were asked to say which federal regulations they would want fixed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Companies spend millions of dollars each year complaining to Congress about burdensome laws and regulations, pressing their concerns in public campaigns and in private meetings. They rarely wait for invitations.

articles.headline: Budget Hawk Eyes Deficit
articles.snippet: Gov. Mitch Daniels of Indiana, a potential Republican presidential candidate, discussed what small government might look like.
articles.abstract: Gov. Mitch Daniels of Indiana, a potential Republican presidential candidate, discussed what small government might look like.

articles.headline: American Airlines in Fee Battle With Web Agencies
articles.snippet: American Airlines is emphasizing its own ticketing technology, which can help it bring in more money from travelers and reduce its costs.
articles.abstract: American Airlines is emphasizing its own ticketing technology, which can help it bring in more money from travelers and reduce its costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: A traveler searching two of the four largest online travel agencies, Orbitz and Expedia, is not going to find any listings for American Airlines flights  at least for the moment.

articles.headline: As Boehner Ascends, His Power Comes With Caveats
articles.snippet: The new House speaker, John A. Boehner, faces the challenge of harnessing the Tea Party zeal.
articles.abstract: The new House speaker, John A. Boehner, faces the challenge of harnessing the Tea Party zeal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio is set to complete a remarkable political revival Wednesday when he becomes the 61st speaker of the House, placing him squarely at the crossroads between the desires of conservative activists to reshape Washington and the reality of delivering in a divided capital.

articles.headline: U.N. Data Notes Sharp Rise in World Food Prices
articles.snippet: Food prices are expected to remain high this year, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago.
articles.abstract: Food prices are expected to remain high this year, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago.
articles.lead_paragraph: World food prices continued to rise sharply in December, bringing them close to the crisis levels that provoked shortages and riots in poor countries three years ago, according to newly released United Nations data.
